11 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testConstruct)
12 {
13  // create class
14  spanning_tree tree;
15 
16  // create an empty gridmap for testing
17  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
18  grid.info.width = 10;
19  grid.info.height = 15;
20  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
21  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
22  grid.data.push_back(0);
23  }
24  }
25 
26  // initialize grid underlying tree
27  tree.initialize_graph(grid);
28 
29  // generate tree
30  tree.construct();
31 
32  // test if expected edges are there
33  edge e(0, 0, 1);
34  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
35  // horizontal edges
36  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
37  e.vlow = i*10 + j;
38  e.vhigh = i*10 + j + 1;
39  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
40  }
41 
42  // vertical edges
43  if (i < 14) {
44  e.vlow = i*10;
45  e.vhigh = (i+1)*10;
46  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
47  }
48  }
49 }

54 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testGetTree)
55 {
56  // create class
57  spanning_tree tree;
58 
59  // create an empty gridmap for testing
60  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
61  grid.info.resolution = 0.1;
62  grid.info.width = 10;
63  grid.info.height = 15;
64  grid.info.origin.position.x = -15;
65  grid.info.origin.position.y = -10;
66  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
67  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
68  grid.data.push_back(0);
69  }
70  }
71 
72  // initialize grid underlying tree
73  tree.initialize_graph(grid);
74 
75  // generate tree
76  tree.construct();
77 
78  // get tree
79  ros::Time::init();
80  geometry_msgs::PoseArray pa = tree.get_tree();
81 
82  // test if expected edges are there
83  geometry_msgs::Pose p;
84  vector<geometry_msgs::Pose>::iterator pi;
85  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
86  // horizontal edges
87  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
88  p.position.x = j * grid.info.resolution + grid.info.origin.position.x + 0.5 * grid.info.resolution;
89  p.position.y = i * grid.info.resolution + grid.info.origin.position.y + 0.5 * grid.info.resolution;
90  tf2::Quaternion direction;
91  direction.setRPY(0, 0, 0);
92  p.orientation = tf2::toMsg(direction);
93  pi = find (pa.poses.begin(), pa.poses.end(), p);
94  EXPECT_TRUE(pi != pa.poses.end());
95  }
96 
97  // vertical edges
98  if (i < 14) {
99  p.position.x = grid.info.origin.position.x + 0.5 * grid.info.resolution;
100  p.position.y = i * grid.info.resolution + grid.info.origin.position.y + 0.5 * grid.info.resolution;
101  tf2::Quaternion direction;
102  direction.setRPY(0, 0, M_PI/2.0);
103  p.orientation = tf2::toMsg(direction);
104  pi = find (pa.poses.begin(), pa.poses.end(), p);
105  EXPECT_TRUE(pi != pa.poses.end());
106  }
107  }
108 }

113 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testConstructVertical)
114 {
115  // create class
116  spanning_tree tree;
117 
118  // create an empty gridmap for testing
119  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
120  grid.info.width = 10;
121  grid.info.height = 15;
122  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
123  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
124  grid.data.push_back(0);
125  }
126  }
127 
128  // initialize grid underlying tree
129  tree.initialize_graph(grid, true); // vertical
130 
131  // generate tree
132  tree.construct();
133 
134  // test if expected edges are there
135  edge e(0, 0, 1);
136  for (int i=0; i<14; ++i) {
137  // vertical edges
138  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
139  e.vlow = i*10 + j;
140  e.vhigh = (i+1)*10 + j;
141  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
142  }
143  }
144  // horizontal edges
145  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
146  e.vlow = j;
147  e.vhigh = j + 1;
148  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
149  }
150 }

155 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testConstructMoore)
156 {
157  // create class
158  spanning_tree tree;
159 
160  // create an empty gridmap for testing
161  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
162  grid.info.width = 10;
163  grid.info.height = 15;
164  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
165  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
166  grid.data.push_back(0);
167  }
168  }
169 
170  // initialize grid underlying tree
171  tree.initialize_graph(grid, false, false); // Moore neighborhood
172 
173  // generate tree
174  tree.construct();
175 
176  // test if expected edges are there
177  edge e(0, 0, 1);
178  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
179  // horizontal edges
180  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
181  e.vlow = i*10 + j;
182  e.vhigh = i*10 + j + 1;
183  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
184  }
185 
186  // vertical edges
187  if (i < 14) {
188  e.vlow = i*10;
189  e.vhigh = (i+1)*10;
190  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
191  }
192  }

198 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testObstacles)
199 {
200  // create class
201  spanning_tree tree;
202 
203  // create an empty gridmap for testing
204  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
205  grid.info.width = 10;
206  grid.info.height = 15;
207  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
208  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
209  grid.data.push_back(0);
210  }
211  }
212 
213  // add obstacles
214  grid.data[6*10 + 4] = 100;
215  grid.data[6*10 + 5] = 100;
216  grid.data[7*10 + 4] = 100;
217  grid.data[7*10 + 5] = 100;
218 
219  // initialize grid underlying tree
220  tree.initialize_graph(grid);
221 
222  // generate tree
223  tree.construct();
224 
225  // test if expected edges are there
226  edge e(0, 0, 1);
227  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
228  // horizontal edges
229  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
230  if ((j==3 || j==4 || j==5) && (i==6 || i==7))
231  continue;
232  e.vlow = i*10 + j;
233  e.vhigh = i*10 + j + 1;
234  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
235  }
236 
237  // vertical edges
238  if (i < 14) {
239  e.vlow = i*10;
240  e.vhigh = (i+1)*10;
241  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
242  }
243  }
244  // vertical edges
245  e.vlow = 5*10 + 6;
246  e.vhigh = 6*10 + 6;
247  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
248  e.vlow = 6*10 + 6;
249  e.vhigh = 7*10 + 6;
250  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
251 }
252 
256 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testObstaclesNeumann)
257 {
258  // create class
259  spanning_tree tree;
260 
261  // create an empty gridmap for testing
262  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
263  grid.info.width = 10;
264  grid.info.height = 15;
265  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
266  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
267  grid.data.push_back(0);
268  }
269  }
270 
271  // add obstacles
272  grid.data[6*10 + 4] = 100;
273  grid.data[6*10 + 5] = 100;
274  grid.data[7*10 + 4] = 100;
275  grid.data[7*10 + 6] = 100;
276  grid.data[8*10 + 4] = 100;
277  grid.data[8*10 + 5] = 100;
278  grid.data[8*10 + 6] = 100;
279 
280  // initialize grid underlying tree
281  tree.initialize_graph(grid);
282 
283  // generate tree
284  tree.construct();
285 
286  // test if expected edges are there
287  edge e(0, 0, 1);
288  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
289  // horizontal edges
290  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
291  if ((j==3 || j==4 || j==5 || j==6) && (i==6 || i==7 || i==8))
292  continue;
293  e.vlow = i*10 + j;
294  e.vhigh = i*10 + j + 1;
295  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
296  }
297  if (i == 6) {
298  e.vlow = i*10 + 6;
299  e.vhigh = i*10 + 7;
300  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
301  }
302 
303  // vertical edges
304  if (i < 14) {
305  e.vlow = i*10;
306  e.vhigh = (i+1)*10;
307  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
308  }
309  }
310  // vertical edges
311  e.vlow = 5*10 + 6;
312  e.vhigh = 6*10 + 6;
313  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
314  e.vlow = 6*10 + 7;
315  e.vhigh = 7*10 + 7;
316  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
317  e.vlow = 7*10 + 7;
318  e.vhigh = 8*10 + 7;
319  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
320 }

325 TEST (UnitTestSpanningTree, testObstaclesMoore)
326 {
327  // create class
328  spanning_tree tree;
329 
330  // create an empty gridmap for testing
331  nav_msgs::OccupancyGrid grid;
332  grid.info.width = 10;
333  grid.info.height = 15;
334  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
335  for (int j=0; j<10; ++j) {
336  grid.data.push_back(0);
337  }
338  }
339 
340  // add obstacles
341  grid.data[6*10 + 4] = 100;
342  grid.data[6*10 + 5] = 100;
343  grid.data[7*10 + 4] = 100;
344  grid.data[7*10 + 6] = 100;
345  grid.data[8*10 + 4] = 100;
346  grid.data[8*10 + 5] = 100;
347  grid.data[8*10 + 6] = 100;
348 
349  // initialize grid underlying tree
350  tree.initialize_graph(grid, false, false); // Moore neighborhood
351 
352  // generate tree
353  tree.construct();
354 
355  // test if expected edges are there
356  edge e(0, 0, 1);
357  for (int i=0; i<15; ++i) {
358  // horizontal edges
359  for (int j=0; j<9; ++j) {
360  if ((j==3 || j==4 || j==5 || j==6) && (i==6 || i==7 || i==8))
361  continue;
362  e.vlow = i*10 + j;
363  e.vhigh = i*10 + j + 1;
364  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
365  }
366  if (i == 6) {
367  e.vlow = i*10 + 6;
368  e.vhigh = i*10 + 7;
369  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
370  }
371 
372  // vertical edges
373  if (i < 14) {
374  e.vlow = i*10;
375  e.vhigh = (i+1)*10;
376  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
377  }
378  }
379  // vertical edges
380  e.vlow = 5*10 + 6;
381  e.vhigh = 6*10 + 6;
382  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
383  e.vlow = 6*10 + 7;
384  e.vhigh = 7*10 + 7;
385  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
386  e.vlow = 7*10 + 7;
387  e.vhigh = 8*10 + 7;
388  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
389  // diagonal edge
390  e.vlow = 6*10 + 6;
391  e.vhigh = 7*10 + 5;
392  e.cost = sqrt(2);
393  EXPECT_EQ(tree.get_mst_edges().count(e), 1);
394 }
